noun.description: A group of people living in the same place or having a particular characteristic in common.
A feeling of fellowship with others, as a result of sharing common attitudes, interests, and goals.
examples: the sense of community that organized religion can provide

noun.description: A group of interdependent organisms of different species growing or living together in a specified habitat.

phrases: It's time to let the international community know that Canada is taking a stand, he said.
Political pressure from the international community is needed to help the situation.
The international community is preparing to impose punitive sanctions.
People smuggling is a crime that the international community needs to combat.
Further action must only be taken if it receives the support of the international community.
origin: Late Middle English: from Old French comunete, reinforced by its source, Latin communitas, from communis (see common).
